children.subject:
I read on the Facebook page announcement that AIing will begin immediately i.e. in the first week itself. So would we get the opportunity to choose the lab(s) we want to AI before that, or we will be assigned the labs.

Thanks a lot!
Can you be an intern without receiving the 1-unit for interning (like for no credit)? Can you also enroll in the mandatory training course for no credit?

history.content:
Hello!

 

As we dive into Spring 2020, we're looking forward to a spectacular semester of CS 61B and need academic interns (formerly, lab assistants) to support students!

 

As an academic intern you will have the chance to help students the way you were helped in CS 61B by working together with them through lab and homework assignments during office hours and lab. Through your semester as an academic intern, you'll gain a deeper understanding of the course material as well as valuable experience toward becoming a tutor or TA. Additionally, you will receive 1 P/NP unit for every 3 hours of academic interning per week.

 

Please note: The EECS department is requiring all academic interns to be enrolled in a mandatory 1-unit online pedagogy course. The time commitment for this course is 20-30 minute per week for reflections on your experience as an academic intern and some additional requirements. You will also be required to attend some orientations and meetings for academic interns every few weeks.

 

The weekly responsibilities of an AI include:

  • 1/2 to 1 hour of preparation (e.g. doing the weekly lab ahead of time, consulting with the TAs, etc.).

  • 2 hours of assisting in lab or office hours.

 

If you’re interested, please fill out the interest form here!

The deadline to fill this form is 01/17/2019, 11:59 PM

 

Looking forward to seeing you all in the Spring!
history.subject: Help Us Teach CS 61B in Spring 2020, and Become an Academic Intern!
